column4: hey, do I need to register or something, to show my writings as black, and name as blue? -thanks in advance, disthanks for the ones not answering me
here in the channel?
irc itself doesn't do colours.. it's probably your client that makes certain lines colored.. like those containing your nick for example
so am I being black-blue?
I don't know what kind of colours you're seening.. you're black on white on my screen.. except when you say Slart.. then your line gets orange on black
it's all configured in whatever client you're running
:o I'm seeing myself as gray only
thanks, I though I was just as "visitor"
it doesn't make a difference if you're registered or not.. of course, registering has other advantages such as "owning" a nickname
try writing /help in your client..
well that answer have to be really be a very difficult to write, as nobody else didn't have the time to even start writing that!

I don't think people are lazy.. it's just that when someone asks questions like that it kind of shows they haven't used google.. haven't read the documentation etc.. so if you answer that question they will just keep on asking about trivial stuff
and to all: I'm not that kinda noob
here's a first tip.. write your question in google.. see if you get any good hits.. if the first hit answers it you shouldn't have to ask it
yes, google is our friend..
and there's usually a channel called #test for testing stuff
check the application database
usually people run aMSN or some other native client
yes, but I need to have as much WIndows looking linux as possible,  and WOW! did patb just got banned!?
nah.. it's just a floodbot.. the ban keeps him from spamming any more.. he'll be unbanned in a minute or so
tab will autocomplete names for you
so [[ <tab> and it will fill in the rest
check out the usage info
